course.subject: SCIE
course.name: Career Building for Science Students
course.description: For Science students only. Co-offered by the School of Science and the Career Center (Dean of Students' Office), this course helps students in exploring careers within the arena of Science and beyond. To achieve this, it guides students to have basic understanding of the career planning process, the current job market and employers' expectation in different fields. This course also equips students with practical job application skills, such as the skills for resume writing, aptitude tests, interviews, group discussions, etc. Experiential learning opportunities and individual feedback will be provided to actively engage students in the learning process. Graded DI, PA or F.
course.exclusions: GNED 2510, GNED 2520

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Very useful course. Highly recommended if you are in any year.
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1: What Defines You?
Week 2: Innerview Skills 1
Week 3: Innerview Skills 2
Week 4: Lumina Spark Portrait
Week 5: CV, CL, LinkedIn 1
Week 6: CV, CL, LinkedIn 2
Week 7: Reducing Anxiety
Week 8: Networking Experience with Industry Leaders
Week 9: Interview like a Pro
Week 10: Group Discussion Practice
Week 11: Mock Interview Practice
Week 12: Mock Interview
Week 13: Accepting Offers, First week of job, Salary
reviews.comment_teaching:
Miss Grace is very kind and gives great insight.

She focuses on "self-grooming":
- Documentations (CV, CL, LinkedIn)
- Attire (How you wear, ZOOM backgrounds, facial expression, etc)
- Speaking (Tone, speed, maneuvering questions)

She greatly accepts any question in class or after class thru e-mail as well.

She also provides prioritized meeting session if needed.
reviews.comment_grading:
DI/PA/F

Grading itself is very lenient, easy.

You won't fail if you don't get the job offer from final interview.

Very difficult to fail unless you really try to.
(you do fail if you don't join more than two classes though)
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment 1: Prepare a Job description you want to apply for, make CV, CL

Assignment 2: Make short clips of you answering interviewer questions

Final Interview: Doing actual interview with people from HR of actual companies

There's not a lot, really. And these are really there to help you understand how to write/speak properly, so the workload itself isn't high.

You won't fail from doing poorly on these. Miss Grace stresses that these are for your practice.

reviews.author: onesanchman
reviews.title: Nice course
reviews.comment_content:
The course is designed to explore yourself, find a matching job, and also how to apply for that job.

1 Course Introduction
2 Innerview (I): Breaking your Mental Model
3 Innerview (II): Together we redefine Success
4 Innerview (III): Lumina Spark Report Debriefing
5 LinkedIn, CV and Cover Letter Writing
6 Networking Skills

Assignment 1: JD, CV & Cover Letter

7 Business Management Skills for non-Business Students
8 Networking Practicum
9 Interview (I): Interview Like a PRO
10 Interview (II): Group Discussion Skills

Assignment 2: Online Interview Video Clips

11 Interview (III): Mock Interview Rehearsal
12 Interview (IV): Mock Interview with Industry Senior
13 Mastering the 1st Day @work
reviews.comment_teaching: There is a lot of interaction in the course. Also, Grace invites other people from various industries to explain some topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course graded DI/PASS/FAIL.

In order to pass the course, you are required to:
1. Attend at least 80% of the classes
2. Complete and submit all assignments set throughout the course on time
3. Participate inside and outside class. Participation is an essential element of the course.
4. Attend the mandatory mock interview.
reviews.comment_workload: Very Light. Just attend lessons and do 2 assignments for the entire course. There are also 2 tests - Lumina and Strong - to know yourself better, each of them will take about an hour.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.title: Useful course even if you're not in Yr 4
reviews.comment_content:
What you will get (physically) from the course:
1) Lumina spark report (a personality test)

2) Strong interest inventory report
(gives you top 10 career that suits your interest)

3) one on one session with Grace (if you want)

4) Meeting industry professional or alumni
(Grace will arrange the industry that suits most people in class)

5) feedback on your CV CL
reviews.comment_teaching:
Grace is very kind and professional
she is very familiar with different industry and what kind of jobs suit different kinds of personality.

This semester the course only have 9 students, so its more relaxing and it doesn't feel like a lesson.
half of the class are yr 4 and the other half are yr 2/3 students, so it's fine if you are not in your final year to join this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass/ Fail / Distinction

You will get a fail if you:
Attain less than 10 class (There's only one class per week)
Fail to attain the Mock interview
Fail to submit assignment

The result of the mock interview does not affect your grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 2 assignment and 1 interview
The assignments are pretty useful

1) You need to hand in your CV CL and Job description for a work that you want to apply. This Homework will be used for the mock interview.
It also allows Grace to give you feedback on the CV and CL

2) Video Interview clips
relatively this Homework is less useful, we only need to record yourself answer around 5 basic interview question

3) Mock Interview
Happens in week 12 or 11, a mock interview with people really working in the industry.
Before the interview Grace will help you get prepared and brainstorm potential questions that will appear in the mock interview and how to answer them.
And the interviewer will give you an definite answer whether he/she will hire you.
